question: Does Ly49Q direct the organization of neutrophil polarization by regulating membrane raft functions? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Ly49Q-dependent polarization and migration were affected by Ly49Q regulation of membrane raft functions.
content.source_2: CRISPR-mediated Ly49Q deletion in murine neutrophils left membrane-raft distribution and frontâ€“rear polarity unchanged, and migration speed was unaffected across CXCL1 gradients; thus, raft dynamics were not directed by Ly49Q.
content.source_3: We propose that Ly49Q is pivotal in switching neutrophils to their polarized morphology and rapid migration upon inflammation, through its spatiotemporal regulation of membrane rafts and raft-associated signaling molecules.
content.source_4: In primary human neutrophils under acute inflammatory conditions, targeted inhibition or overexpression of Ly49Q did not modify raft clustering, and polarization defects persisted after cholesterol repletion, indicating that Ly49Q-driven migration occurs independently of raft functions.
